subject: SatCon to present Invited Paper at 2007 IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting
body:
SatCon to present Invited Paper at 2007 IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting

BOSTON, Jun 25, 2007 (BUSINESS WIRE) --  SatCon Technology Corporation(R) (Nasdaq CM: SATC), a developer and supplier of power management and system architecture solutions for the alternative energy and distributed power markets, today announced that it will be presenting at the 2007 IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting in Tampa, Florida, this week. The theme of this year's Annual General Meeting is "Powering the Future, Today". SatCon's presentation and paper is titled "Advanced Semiconductor Impact on Distributed Generation, Energy Storage and the Utility Grid". "In this era of energy resource depletion, energy supply fragility, and increasing concern over the environmental consequences of our fossil fuel based economy, the IEEE Annual Meeting is focused on these critical concerns," said Dr. Leo Casey, Chief Technology Officer of SatCon Technology Corporation. "Our paper at the Annual meeting addresses the great advantages in efficiency and reliability that are derived from distributed, and in particular, renewable-distributed generation. Building on our experience as a leading provider of Utility Scale Photovoltaic and Fuel Cell Inverters, we also present the value enhancement that is derived from the addition of sufficient storage to the intermittent renewable resource. The ability of advanced semiconductors, such as Silicon-Carbide, to impact this value proposition by enabling robust MicroGrids is the unifying conclusion of this presentation." About SatCon Technology Corporation SatCon Technology Corporation is a developer and manufacturer of electronics and generators/motors for the Renewable Energy, Hybrid-Electric Vehicle, Grid Support, High Reliability Electronics and Advanced Power Technology markets. For further information, please visit the SatCon website at www.satcon.com.
